soc.communication

Interface SOCServerSocket

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemServerSocket, NetServerSocket

    public interface SOCServerSocket
    SOCServerSocket allows server applications to communicate with client Connections, with a common API for local Practice Mode and actual networked traffic. 
      1.0.0 - 2007-11-18 - initial release, becoming part of jsettlers v1.1.00
  1.0.3 - 2008-08-08 - add change history; no other changes in this file since 1.0.0 (jsettlers 1.1.00 release)
  1.0.4 - 2008-09-04 - no change in this file
  1.0.5 - 2009-05-31 - no change in this file
  1.0.5.1- 2009-10-26- remove unused import EOFException
  2.0.0 - 2017-11-01 - Rename StringServerSocket -> SOCServerSocket, NetStringServerSocket -> NetServerSocket,
                       LocalStringServerSocket -> StringServerSocket
  2.1.0 - 2020-01-09 - NetServerSocket call setReuseAddress (SO_REUSEADDR)
  2.3.0 - 2020-04-27 - no change in this file
    Since:
    1.1.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Connection accept()
      For server to call.
      void close()
      Close down server socket immediately: Do not let inbound data drain.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        Connection accept()
           throws java.net.SocketException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        For server to call. Blocks waiting for next inbound connection.
        Returns:
        The server-side peer to the inbound client connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if network has a problem accepting
        java.net.SocketException - if our setEOF() has been called, thus new clients won't receive any data from us
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Close down server socket immediately: Do not let inbound data drain. Accept no new inbound connections. Send EOF marker in all current outbound connections. Like java.net.ServerSocket, any thread currently blocked in accept() must throw a SocketException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
